pageTitle: Comprehensive Monitoring Statistics (Oracle GlassFish Server 3.0.1 Administration Guide)
textBeforeTable: Table 8–5 EJB Cache Monitoring Statistics The statistics available for EJB caches are listed in the following table. server.applications.appname.ejbmodulename.bean-cache.ejbname.statistic  Use the following dotted name pattern for EJB cache statistics: EJB Cache Statistics    Timer Statistics    EJB Pool Statistics    EJB Method Statistics    EJB Container Statistics    EJB Cache Statistics    Statistics available for applications are shown in the following sections:  server.applications.appname.ejbmodulename.ejbname.bean-cache.statistic  EJBs fit into the tree of objects as shown in Applications Tree Hierarchy. Use the following dotted name pattern to get applications statistics: EJB Statistics    Web Statistics    Transaction Service Statistics    Thread Pool Statistics    Security Statistics    Resource Statistics (Connection Pool)    ORB Statistics (Connection Manager)    Network Statistics    JVM Statistics    JRuby Statistics    JMS/Connector Service Statistics    Jersey Statistics    HTTP Service Statistics    EJB Statistics    The tables in the following sections list the statistics that are available for each monitorable object:
textAfterTable: numbeansincache RangeStatistic  The number of beans in the cache. This is the current size of the cache.  numpassivations CountStatistic  Number of passivated beans. Applies only to stateful session beans.  numpassivationerrors CountStatistic  Number of errors during passivation. Applies only to stateful session beans.  numexpiredsessionsremoved CountStatistic  Number of expired sessions removed by the cleanup thread. Applies only to stateful session beans.  numpassivationsuccess CountStatistic  Number of times passivation completed successfully. Applies only to stateful session beans.  EJB Container Statistics Use the following dotted name pattern for EJB container statistics: server.applications.appname.ejbmodulename.container.ejbname The statistics available for EJB containers are listed in the following table.
